answers.answer: Hi,I don't think it warrants going to the ER but I would call your doctor and get a good check-up. Since Diabetes is in the mix I would not fool around with it. While you are waiting to see your doctor try taking long, hot baths for the muscle aches and see if that helps at all. Like I said, they won't do much at the ER for withdrawal but if it gets worse and seems as though something else is going on, then get ere right away.Certainly you have all the symptoms of withdrawal and since you have been on the pain medication for such a long time, it is very possible.I hope you get to feeling better soon. Let us know how you make out.

question: I have been taking Vicodin on and off again for about 10 years for Chronic pain.  Last week I really was doing bad.  My back was killing me and I was upset that hubby was called out of town on the weekend.  I was in pain and didn't want to deal with the world and I just wanted to sleep.  I was taking about 4-5 Vicodins a day, muscle relaxer, and ambian.  About 2 days of doing that stupid routine I felt like I had the flu!  Hot, (no temp), whole body ached, legs hurt, horrible headache, etc.  I got a wake up call after I posted just my symptoms on face book.  And they said it sounded like I was going through some kind of withdrawl.  I stopped taking the vicodin and muscle relaxer cold turkey.  After a week I still feel like crap.  Still the flu like symptoms, aches and pains.  I was going to go to the ER last night because I felt so horrible, but didn't want to admit aloud what I have been doing to myself.  How much longer will I have to feel like this?  Anything to help me feel better?  Is my diabetes making it more complicated?
title: Withdrawl or flu?
